citations.narrative:
Chicken wire with sharp points protruding out was observed in an enclosure that contained 1 chicken and 1 pheasant. In
addition an enclosure containing 1 chicken and 4 doves had a ceiling that was in disrepair. Part of the ceiling was opened
with what appeared to be exposed insulation. In addition, there was the potential for the doves to fly up into the rafter
section of the ceiling. Sharp points and exposed insulation can cause injury to the birds. The housing facilities for the birds
must be kept in good repair to protect the birds from injury.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The facility does not have an environment enhancement plan in place for the birds. Not having an environment
enhancement plan in place doesn't ensure the psychological well-being of the birds. The facility must develop, document,
and follow a species-appropriate plan for all birds in its care. The plan must be approved by the Attending Veterinarian.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by 2/2/26 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee and must
wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
End of report.
n

narrative:
3.150(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
Chicken wire with sharp points protruding out was observed in an enclosure that contained 1 chicken and 1 pheasant. In 
addition an enclosure containing 1 chicken and 4 doves had a ceiling that was in disrepair. Part of the ceiling was opened 
with what appeared to be exposed insulation. In addition, there was the potential for the doves to fly up into the rafter 
section of the ceiling. Sharp points and exposed insulation can cause injury to the birds. The housing facilities for the birds 
must be kept in good repair to protect the birds from injury. 
3.154 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
The facility does not have an environment enhancement plan in place for the birds. Not having an environment 
enhancement plan in place doesn't ensure the psychological well-being of the birds. The facility must develop, document, 
and follow a species-appropriate plan for all birds in its care. The plan must be approved by the Attending Veterinarian. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by 2/2/26 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee and must 
wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires. 
 
End of report. 
 
 n
